level.text: In any action, the Board’s General Counsel may request that the parties appear for a pre-hearing conference to consider the following:
The necessity or desirability of amendments to the pleadings;
The possibility of obtaining the admission of facts and documents which will avoid unnecessary proof;
Limitation of the number of witnesses; and
Other matters which may aid in the disposition of the action.

The Board may enter an order which recites the action taken at the conference, the amendments allowed to the pleadings, and the agreements made by the parties as to any of the matters considered which limit the issues for hearing, to those issues not disposed of by admissions or agreements of counsel or parties. The order, when entered, shall control the subsequent course of the action.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 45 D.C. Reg. 432, 444 (January 23, 1998).
